content: sherpa beanie difficulty ​​intermediate beginner this item is worked in the round and uses basic knit and purl stitches materials ● about 125-150 yards worsted weight yarn i used red heart super saver in mint ● size 8/5mm circular needles 16 or 24 long ● size 8/5mm dpn s ● tapestry needle ● scissors ● stitch marker description this beanie is a copycat of the fur sherpa pom beanie by cc i ve written it up in two sizes it comes in kids size that fits toddlers and children and adult size which fits teens and adults if you wish to make it bigger simply cast on in multiples of 9 and then add to get to an even multiple of 4 s for the brim then decrease to a multiple of 9 in the set up round child size is shown in the parentheses adult size is shown first instagram @imakeknottystuff ravelry stitches by beth 1 stitches used co=cast on k=knit p=purl k2tog=knit two together pm=place marker sts=stitches pattern co 93 85 sts join in the round pass first cast on stitch to right needle pass last cast on stitch over first then put first stitch back on left needle pull ends tight to close gap pm 92 84 sts this is the co method i use ​https //www youtube com/watch v=vj_1s54hbpy this is the method for joining that i use h​ ttps //www youtube com/watch v=exjpwbe0mtk brim section row 1 k2 p2 rib for 25 20 row 92 84 sts decrease set up round ​adult ​ ​ k2 k2tog k40 k2tog k45 90 sts and 2 crown decrease section adult row 1 k1 k2tog repeat 60 sts row 2 k1 k2tog repeat 40 sts switch to dpn s row 3 k2tog repeat 20 sts instagram @imakeknottystuff ravelry stitches by beth 2 row 4 k2tog repeat 10 sts cut a long tail using your tapestry needle weave through your stitches and pull tight turn inside out and tie off weave in ends add pom pom to the top child row 1 k1 k2tog repeat 54 sts row 2 k2tog repeat 27 sts switch to dpn s row 3 k2tog repeat k1 14 sts row k2tog repeat 7 sts cut a long tail using your tapestry needle weave through your stitches and pull tight turn inside
